thread.title: Tennis: Bentonville plays host to Class 7A state tournament
thread.title_full: Tennis: Bentonville plays host to Class 7A state tournament

title: Tennis: Bentonville plays host to Class 7A state tournament
text:
Tennis: Bentonville plays host to Class 7A state tournament Bentonville plays host to state tennis tournament By Henry Apple Posted: October 19, 2015 at 1 a.m. 
BENTONVILLE -- A collegiate tennis atmosphere can be experienced occasionally at Memorial Park, especially since it is the regular host for the Great American Conference championships each spring. 
That same type of environment is what Bentonville coach Nick Nersesian expects to see when the venue hosts the Class 7A state tennis tournament over the next two days. 
Class 7A state tennis tournament 
at Memorial Park, Bentonville 
Boys singles 
First round (noon) 
LeDarrien Ledbetter, LR Central vs. Jake Keefauver, Bentonville (Court 1); Will McCombs, Fayetteville vs. Myers Simpson, LR Catholic (Court 6); Trevor Mallioux, Fayetteville vs. Adam Barnett, Conway (Court 2); Kess McSwain, LR Central vs. Jack Vaughan, Rogers High (Court 5). 
Quarterfinals (4 p.m.) 
Michael Zheng, Rogers High vs. Ledbetter-Keefauver winner (Court 1); Brayden Montgomery, Van Buren vs. McCombs-Simpson winner (Court 5); Parker Stearns, LR Central vs. Mallioux-Barnett winner (Court 6); Sriker Chikkala, Bentonville vs. McSwain-Vaughan winner (Court 2). 
Boys doubles 
First round (10 a.m.) 
Wingfield/Piazza, LR Catholic vs. Rajsombath/Taylor, FS Northside (Court 5); Breach/Matthews, Rogers High vs. Dusha/Anderson, Van Buren (Court 1); Benford/Berry, Springdale Har-Ber vs. Bankston/Cabot (Court 2); Porter/Saniseng, Van Buren vs. Hays/Gantz (Court 6). 
Quarterfinals (2 p.m.) 
Corbell/Kern vs. Wingfield/Piazza-Rajsombath/Taylor winner (Court 6); Bierbaum/Maxon, LR Central vs. Breach/Matthews-Dusha/Anderson winner (Court 2); Nolan/Weeks, LR Catholic vs. Benford/Berry-Bankston/Cason winner (Court 5); Hargrove/Neal, Bentonville vs. Porter/Saniseng-Hayd/Gantz winner (Court 1). 
Girls singles 
First round (noon) 
Karlee Hart, Van Buren vs. Jessica Geren, FS Northside (Court 7); Shreya Majagi, Rogers High vs. Olivia Blair, LR Central (Court 3); Cam Cupelli, Fayetteville vs. Allison Lemley, Van Buren (Court 8); Becky Sherman, LR Central vs. Kruti Shah, Bentonville (Court 4). 
Quarterfinals (4 p.m.) 
Adriana Canigova, Bentonville vs. Hart-Geren winner (Court 3); Brooke Buckner, Mount St. Mary, vs. Majagi-Blair winner (Court 8); Margaret Lucas, Mount St. Mary vs. Cupelli-Lemley winner (Court 7); Katherine Tang, Rogers High vs. Sherman-Shah winner, Court 4. 
Girls doubles 
First round (10 a.m.) 
Wiederker/Patel, Van Buren vs. Bain/Rogers, Fayetteville (Court 7); Lewis/McKinney, Rogers High vs. Lukacs/Norris, Mount St. Mary (Court 3); Churchill/Mauromoustakos, Fayetteville vs. Sutter/Patel, LR Central (Court 4); Moore/Denton, Conway vs. Coleman/Hugg, FS Northside (Court 8). 
Quarterfinals (2 p.m.) 
Sullivan/Cheung-Damonte, Bentonville vs. Wiederker/Patel-Bain/Rogers winner (Court 3); Rogers/Jones, Conway vs. Lewis/McKinney-Lukacs/Norris winner (Court 7); Norris/Noonan, Mount St. Mary vs. Churchill/Mauromoustakos-Sutter/Patel winner (Court 8); Hargrove-Gean, Bentonville vs. Moore/Denton-Coleman/Hugg winner (Court 4). 
"It's been one of the things we've been looking at, coming off of the conference championships," Nersesian said. "We've been here, and we understand the courts, the wind and what happens when we have a great crowd up here. I'm not sure the Central will be used to this college-type atmosphere. 
"Between points, you're going to hear a lot of cheering and a lot of people saying 'go' and 'get after it' and 'that's a great play' -- all kinds of cheering. I'm not sure if it will bode well with the Central people, but any time Rogers, Fayetteville, Bentonville and Har-Ber get after each other around here, it's a college atmosphere." 
Rogers High, Fayetteville and Bentonville are expected to continue their battle for boys supremacy like they did during the 7A-West Conference championships earlier this month. Rogers and Fayetteville wound up sharing the league title with 11 points, while Bentonville -- the five-time defending state champion -- was on their heels with 10 points. 
The 7A-Central schools could have something to say about that matter. Brayden Montgomery of Van Buren and Parker Stearns of Little Rock Catholic are highly regarded players and could take points away from the area schools, while Nersesian believes the boys doubles division is a wide-open race for anybody to take. 
"Rogers, Fayetteville and us have plenty of personnel on all sides of those brackets to battle with the Central," Nersesian said. "In the Central, you have Catholic, Little Rock Central and Van Buren that can change the dynamics of the tournament. I think it's a more balanced bracket than ever before." 
Nersesian likes Bentonville's chances of repeating at state champion in the girls division. The Lady Tigers, who dominated the 7A-West Conference tournament, have the maximum six entries, with Adriana Canigova and Kruti Shah in singles play and the duos of Bessie Sullivan and Taylor Cheung-Damonte and Avery Hargrove and Emily Gean in doubles competition. 
Mount St. Mary will provide the Lady Tigers' stiffest challenge as the Belles also have the maximum six entries. 
"We have the best possible position we could be with everybody in," Nersesian said. "Rogers was right there behind us, and Mount St. Mary is probably the strongest teams out of the Central. 
"They have some freshmen that are going to step up and have some top seeds. It's going to be interesting to see if those freshmen can bring it, and they normally do because they play in Southern tournaments and preparing for tournaments like this." 
The tournament begins at 10 a.m. both days. First-round and quarterfinal matches will be held today, while the semifinals and championships are slated for Tuesday. 
Henry Apple can be reached at happle@nwadg.com or on Twitter @NWAHenry. 
Sports on 10/19/2015
